newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela Senate to discuss labor reform next Wed.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela Senate to discuss labor reform next Wed.

text.p: Venezuela's Senate will probably open discussions on a crucial and eagerly-awaited labor law reform bill next Wednesday, Congress's president said.

The bill, which forms part of larger package of reforms expected to liberalize labor markets and revamp Venezuela's decaying social security system, passed speedily through the lower chamber last week with only slight modifications.
Congressional president Cristobal Fernandez told reporters the Senate might recommend further changes "even though that would require the bill to return to the lower house."
Under Venezuelan legislative procedures, changes proposed by the Senate return to the lower house Chamber of Deputies for a second debate.
